result.execSummary:
All charges against Alexander J Ware in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alexander J Ware is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Copy of minutes from DISM Event and CH Hrg on 7/1/22 sent electronically to DCJ

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Adam Welch for Erin Nagy.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dr. Pressig's report concludes defn has been restored to competency following Tx. Colloquy w/ Atty Welch. Colloquy w/ defn; defn in agreement with the report and doctor's findings. Counsel do not wish to present evidence contrary to the doctor's findings. CT makes findings and finds defn has now been restored to legal competency and orders these proceedings to continue. CT orders defn discharged from the commitment.
to produce for 7/1/22 competency hearing

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Defendant in court, in custody.  Awais Khaleel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Participants who fall under ch. 950 compliance appeared via telephone. On it's own motion, the CT raises competency in this case. CT adopts the doctor's report in 22CM190. Dr. Schoenecker's report concludes defn does not meet the standards for legal competency and unable to assist in his defense. The doctor concludes with treatment, the defn is likely to become restored to competency with in the statutory time period. Colloquy w/ defn; defn does not agree with the doctor's conclusions. Witness unavailable. CT reschedules to the afternoon at 2:30 pm. CT directs ADA Khaleel to contact witness f/w. Dr. Schoenecker available f/w. CT proceeds to competency hearing f/w. Witness Dr. C. Schoenecker duly sworn and testified via telephone. Direct exam by ADA Khaleel. State moves Dr. Schoenecker's report into evidence. CT receives Dr. Schoenecker's report and ID's as Exhibit 1. Doctor concludes defn will likely to be restored with an involuntary order to treat through inpatient Tx. Statement by Defn. Argument by ADA Khaleel. CT makes findings and finds defn does not meet the standards for legal competency. CT finds with treatment, the defn is likely to become restored to competency. CT orders defn committed to the dept and that commitment and transport to an inpatient institute to commence f/w. CT makes findings and finds the commitment order is to include involuntary administration of medication. CT orders case suspended.  Competency evaluation due date scheduled for June 24, 2022.  Competency evaluation due date scheduled for September 26, 2022.  Competency evaluation due date scheduled for November 24, 2022.
Competency hearing on March 24, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Competency hearing on March 24, 2022 at 10:45 am.

The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
